title: Exclusion of @BerkeleyScanner from Press Conference

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidelines, instructions, or similar guidance concerning the issuance of press credentials by the Alameda County District Attorney. If the office of the District Attorney is not responsible for issuing press credentials, then please provide any policy, guidelines, instructions, or similar guidance applicable to the issuance of press credentials used for media events held by or for the District Attorney.

2. A copy of the "long-standing" standards referenced by Patti Lee's statement ot the San Francisco Chronicle, reported here: https://www.sfchronicle.com/politics/article/pamela-price-reporter-18525641.php.

3. All records reflecting any review of the credentials of Emilie Raguso and/or the Berkeley Scanner.

4. All records reflecting the inclusion or removal of Emilie Raguso and/or the Berkeley Scanner from any media distribution list.

5. A copy of any current media distribution list used by the Office of the District Attorney.

6. A copy of the media sign-in sheet used for the November 29, 2023 press conference.

7. All records reflecting the "vett[ing]" of any "media outlet[]" as referenced by Patti Lee's statement to the San Francisco Chronicle, reported here: https://www.sfchronicle.com/politics/article/pamela-price-reporter-18525641.php. This request is limited to records reflecting any "vetting" conducted since January 1, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Bert Lance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bert Lance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Thomas Bertram Lance (aka Bert Lance) (June 3, 1931 - August 15, 2013). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2013/08/16/us/politics/bert-lance-carter-adviser-dies-at-82.html Lance was forced to resign from the Office of Management and Budget and over corruption allegations from earlier in his career and was later a named party in the BCCI affair.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: FBI: Writer and Activist John Nichols

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Writer and Activist John Nichols
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Bureau records mentioning or pertaining to New Mexico-based writer John Nichols (July 23, 1940 – November 27, 2023). Nichols was a self-described Marxist and political activist who wrote novels such as "The Milagro Beanfield War" about rural New Mexico. His death was widely reported. 

https://www.abqjournal.com/news/late-author-john-nichols-had-a-passion-for-writing-fishing-human-rights-and-his-taos/article_26708132-8f09-11ee-b1aa-7ba7ed798bad.htm

This request is for any and all records about John Nichols from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Nichols held by the Albuquerque Field Office. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to John Nichols. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to the writer John Nichols. 

Please also consider this request to include bureau collection, discussion or examination of Nichols' writings, public appearances or media coverage. If you cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the Bureau's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you on this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation
    or inquiry into William T. Kirby (1911 - 1990). Proof of death is not
    required as his death was widely reported:
    https://www.nytimes.com/1990/10/03/obituaries/william-t-kirby-is-dead-at-79-a-macarthur-foundation-leader.html

    Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and
    the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and
    cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and
    companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at
    the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have

    destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating

    not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said

    Sincerely,

communications.communication:

title: Tacoma PD: 1999 Pierce County Doe

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Tacoma PD: 1999 Pierce County Doe
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a request to the Tacoma Police Department for all documents, dispatch logs, incident reports, follow-up reports, copies of medical examiner's reports or photographs, or anything that could be construed as a "case file" or "case documents" or "relevant documents" related to the discovery of the skeletal remains of an unidentified decedent on August 22nd of 1999 in Tacoma. Please include a search for any electronic communication (utilizing fax, teletype, email, or any method) with NCIC or WACIC related to these unidentified remains.

The Tacoma PD case number is: 99-234-0345. The NamUs case number is UP16178. The case is assigned to a Detective Lindsey Wade. 

There are websites on the internet that catalog this case:

https://unidentified-awareness.fandom.com/wiki/Pierce_County_Doe_(1999)

According to publicly released information the conditions of the remains indicates that the conditions of the remains was "consistent with advanced decomposition and not trauma."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: AdventHealth - Numerical Breakdown of Discrimination Complaints and Charges to the EEOC

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: AdventHealth - Numerical Breakdown of Discrimination Complaints and Charges to the EEOC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records, within the time frame of 2017 to 2023. to the date on which this request is processed, and with respect to the following criteria and jurisdiction of the EEOC:
. 
1. Records that numerically separate the complaints of discrimination by present and previous employees of Adventist Health System/Sunbelt Inc. dba AdventHealth. To clarify, I request records that numerically breakdown complaints of discrimination against AdventHealth by AdventHealth location, to be interpreted as each individual location, and that it be separated by state, type of complaint of discrimination (such as on the basis of ADA, color, race, religion, sex, mental health and so to include all forms of discrimination within the scope of the EEOC).

2. To preface - the distinct difference between this and (1) is filing a charge against AdventHealth - I request records that numerically separate the complaints of discrimination by present and previous employees of Adventist Health System/Sunbelt Inc. dba AdventHealth. To clarify, I request records that numerically breakdown charges of discrimination against AdventHealth and the breakdown be by AdventHealth location, to be interpreted as each individual location, and that it be separated by state, type of complaint of discrimination that led to a charge against AdventHealth (such as on the basis of ADA, color, race, religion, sex, mental health and so to include all forms of discrimination within the scope of the EEOC). If no such notion or meaningful distinction exists, then this may be disregarded.

3. Records that specify that numerically indicate the charging part having won the case, so to speak, as well as by percentage, against AdventHealth (ie, Charging Party v. AdventHealth). I separately request numerically the same as the prior sentence, but excluding cases in which Charging Parties have withdrawn, not responded, or have settled with AdventHealth. To clarify, this need not include any separation by location, state, type of discrimination, and so on. 

4. Records that specify that numerically indicate the Respondent Party (being AdventHealth) having won the case, so to speak, as well as by percentage, against Charging Party. To clarify, this need not include any separation by location, state, type of discrimination, and so on.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

title: Agency Scope, Investigative Authority, and Methods Employed During the Course of ACHA Investigations into Healthcare Facilities

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Scope, Investigative Authority, Power, Scope, and Methods Employed During the Course of ACHA Investigations into Healthcare Facilities
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records, within the time frame of 2017 to 2023. to the date on which this request is processed, and with respect to the following criteria and within the jurisdiction of the Agency for Healthcare Administration (ACHA):

1a. Records that detail the consequences, ramifications, or disciplinary actions that can be taken against a healthcare facility in summation and if there exists any meaningful difference in terms of potential for disciplinary action according to precise setting (ie, hospitals, nursing homes, ambulatory clinics, and so on), within the context of the scope and authority of the ACHA.

1b. Contingent upon there existing a meaningful difference in potential for disciplinary actions according to the precise setting (ie, a hospital setting versus a nursing home setting versus an ambulatory clinic) then I request records that separate out the disciplinary action for each type of healthcare facility.

2. Records that detail the precise scope of the ACHA itself as it relates to its investigative authority, power, and methods employed when investigating healthcare facilities. Additionally, I request the persons with which possess such investigative authority by listing position titles within ACHA.

3. Records, manuals, and/or guidelines that detail how the ACHA handles complaints of healthcare facilities. Additionally, I request if ACHA makes use of or employs artificial intelligence (AI) or large language models (LLMs) in the handling of either complaints or investigations into healthcare facilities.

4. Records that detail the precise scope and investigatory authority, power, methods employed (in the context of an investigation) as well as the precise extent of persons with investigative authority as deemed by ACHA. Additionally, if it is the case that multiple persons (meaning greater than one position title at ACHA has investigative authority) then I request records that separate both the position titles and the meaning distinction in terms of investigative authority, power, scope, and employed employed according to each position title (if such a notion and if such records exist within ACHA). 

5. Records that detail the complete listing of agencies with which the ACHA [regularly] cooperates with as it relates to investigations into healthcare facilities.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Government Analyst Scope, Investigative Authority, and Listing of Agencies FDOH Cooperates With
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records, within the time frame of 2017 to 2023. to the date on which this request is processed, and with respect to the following criteria and within the jurisdiction of the Florida Department of Health (FDOH):

1. Records that detail the consequences, ramifications, or disciplinary actions that can be taken against a healthcare facility in summation, within the context of the scope and authority of the FDOH.

2. Records that detail the precise scope of the FDOH itself as it relates to its investigative authority, power, and methods employed when investigating healthcare facilities.

3. Records, manuals, and/or guidelines that detail how the FDOH handles complaints of healthcare facilities. Additionally, I request if FDOH makes use of or employs artificial intelligence (AI) or large language models (LLMs) in the handling of either complaints or investigations into healthcare facilities.

4. Records that detail the precise scope and investigatory authority, power, methods employed (in the context of an investigation) as well as the precise extent of a Government Analyst' ability to investigate within the context of the FDOH. Additionally, I request records that detail who or whom (to clarify further, the title of such persons) has the authority or power to meaningfully conduct an investigation beyond a Government Analyst, if any such persons exist.

5. Records that detail the complete listing of agencies with which the FDOH [regularly] cooperates with as it relates to investigations into healthcare facilities.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to be processed. Depending on the time frame for the request to be fulfilled and any fees that may be incurred, I may revise the criteria.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

title: Applicability of Fourth Amendment (Private Employers)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552. I hereby request the following records:

I request all records within the jurisdiction of the Department of Justice (DOJ) within the time frame of 2017 to 2023, to be the day on which this request is processed, and with respect to the following criteria:

1. Records that detail if or what manner the fourth amendment may apply in the context of a private employer compelling employees to submit to reasonable suspicion testing given the direct nexus of SAMHSA, when it is known that such private employer complies with the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988, if such records exist within the DOJ’s jurisdiction.

2. Records that detail the volume (ie, numerically) of civil rights complaints in the context of employment that fall outside of the scope of the EEOC.

3. Records that detail how the DOJ Civil Rights Division separates out potential civil rights violations in the context of employment if such civil rights violations fall outside the scope of the EEOC. Additionally, I request, if known to the DOJ, what agency is most appropriate if a civil rights violation occurs in the context of employment but falls outside of the scope of the EEOC.

4. Records that detail how a private employer could be considered a state actor, acting on behalf of the federal government, or acting under the direction of the federal government under the pretense of reasonable suspicion testing per the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988 and given the direct nexus to SAMHSA under such circumstances.

2. Records related to the handling of fictitious or materially false statements to federal government agencies made by private employers.

3. Records related to if or in what manner a private employer, if such private employer can be proven to be acting on behalf of the federal government, can conspire against rights (in oppressing an employee’s civil rights) and the distinction between a civil and criminal manner pertaining to conspiracy against rights, if any such record exists.

4.Records/documents that relate to a private employer and consequences, ramifications, or disciplinary actions to such private employer when intentionally abusing or defrauding the United States (ie, a Federal Government Agency) and in what manner it can be said to be so, according to the DOJ.

5. Records related to remedy available to employees when civil rights can be meaningfully construed to have been violated by a private employer, if such records exist.

6. The most appropriate agency for which an employee may seek remedy for civil rights violations by a private employer, if not the DOJ Civil Rights Division or DOJ Criminal Division, and if known to the DOJ.


I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to be processed. Depending on the time frame for the request to be fulfilled and any fees that may be incurred, I may revise the criteria.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

To Whom It May Concern:

To clarify (5), it is meant to be interpreted in which such civil rights violations occur in the context of employment yet outside of the scope of the EEOC.

Thank you,

Bailey Pillon

title: Records of Travel, Henry Alfred Kissinger  (May 27, 1923 – November 29, 2023)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records of Travel, Henry Alfred Kissinger  (May 27, 1923 – November 29, 2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of travel (including any border crossings, records of referral to secondary screening, etc.) as well as any and Customs declarations for the individual named below (with identifying information)

Full name: Henry Alfred Kissinger
DOB: May 27, 1923 
POB: Fürth, Germany

Please note that it is likely that Kissinger had multiple passports. All records concerning the individual with the date of birth listed above should be considered responsive. 

Mr. Kissinger is deceased. Please find proof of death attached. Privacy interests for dead persons are diminished. Records should be released in the overwhelming public interest as Kissinger was a highly influential diplomat, political scientist and geopolitical consultant who served as United States secretary of state and national security advisor under the presidential administrations of Richard Nixon and Gerald Ford.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.communication: Your confirmation code is 934697

title: Applicability of Fourth Amendment (Private Employers)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Applicability of Fourth Amendment (Private Employers)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552. I hereby request the following records:

I request all records within the jurisdiction of the Department of Justice (DOJ) within the time frame of 2017 to 2023, to be the day on which this request is processed, and with respect to the following criteria:

1. Records that detail if or what manner the fourth amendment may apply in the context of a private employer compelling employees to submit to reasonable suspicion testing given the direct nexus of SAMHSA, when it is known that such private employer complies with the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988, if such records exist within the DOJ’s jurisdiction.

2. Records that detail the volume (ie, numerically) of civil rights complaints in the context of employment that fall outside of the scope of the EEOC.

3. Records that detail how the DOJ Civil Rights Division separates out potential civil rights violations in the context of employment if such civil rights violations fall outside the scope of the EEOC. Additionally, I request, if known to the DOJ, what agency is most appropriate if a civil rights violation occurs in the context of employment but falls outside of the scope of the EEOC.

4. Records that detail how a private employer could be considered a state actor, acting on behalf of the federal government, or acting under the direction of the federal government under the pretense of reasonable suspicion testing per the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988 and given the direct nexus to SAMHSA under such circumstances.

2. Records related to the handling of fictitious or materially false statements to federal government agencies made by private employers.

3. Records related to if or in what manner a private employer, if such private employer can be proven to be acting on behalf of the federal government, can conspire against rights (in oppressing an employee’s civil rights) and the distinction between a civil and criminal manner pertaining to conspiracy against rights, if any such record exists.

4.Records/documents that relate to a private employer and consequences, ramifications, or disciplinary actions to such private employer when intentionally abusing or defrauding the United States (ie, a Federal Government Agency) and in what manner it can be said to be so, according to the DOJ.

5. Records related to remedy available to employees when civil rights can be meaningfully construed to have been violated by a private employer, if such records exist.

6. The most appropriate agency for which an employee may seek remedy for civil rights violations by a private employer, if not the DOJ Civil Rights Division, and if known to the DOJ.


I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to be processed. Depending on the time frame for the request to be fulfilled and any fees that may be incurred, I may revise the criteria.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

title: Agency Scope per F.S. 114.0455

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Scope per F.S. 114.0455
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida's Sunshine Laws:

I request all records within the jurisdiction of the Florida Department of Financial Services within the time frame of 2017 to 2023, to be the day on which this request is processed, and with respect to the following criteria:

1. Records/documents that describe and detail the policies and procedures surrounding reasonable suspicion subject an employee to drug testing per Florida's Drug-Free Workplace Act (F.S.112.0455).

2. Records/documents that relate to policies/procedures/manuals (such as training manual(s)) for which Medical Review Officers (MROs) outline guidelines with which MROs adhere to per F.S. 112.0455.

3. Records/documents that relate to employer abuse of F.S. 112.0455, including but not limited to making false or fictitious statements to Florida Department of Regulations Workers’ Compensation Division, and the consequences of an employer abusing the aforementioned Florida Statute.

4.Records/documents that relate to employer consequences, ramifications, or disciplinary actions when intentionally abusing or defrauding the Florida Department of Financial Services per F.S. 112.0455  (as an example, by trick or deceit, lack of reasonable suspicion, making materially false or fictitious statements).

5. Records/documents relating to if/when/how the fourth amendment applies as it relates to private employers (ie, nongovernmental employers) subjecting employees to reasonable suspicion drug testing and if such cases are known to Florida Department of Financial Services.

6. Records/documents relating to a private employer in which such employer could be considered a state actor, acting on behalf of the government, or under the direction of the government within the context of reasonable suspicion testing.

7. Records/documents relating to if or in what manner an employer’s policies can extend beyond the scope of the F.S. 112.0455 and the Florida Department of Financial Services’ guidelines (if such records exist).

8. Records relating to persons who can formally assess an employee within a hospital setting under the pretense of reasonable suspicion testing. Additionally, the qualifications, credentials, licensure, or training that such persons must have.

9. The scope and extent to which the Agency for Healthcare Administers applies to F.S. 112.0455 as ACHA is expressly stated throughout such Florida Statue, it is known or can be clearly elucidated.

10. What sections of F.S. 112.0455, if any, an employer need or must adhere to if a private employer voluntarily chooses not to comply with the stated Florida Statue.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to be processed. Depending on the time frame for the request to be fulfilled and any fees that may be incurred, I may revise the criteria.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

To clarify: This relates to specifically the Division of Workers’ Compensation as it is known to be the specific division that enforces and oversees the aforementioned F.S.

Thank you,

Bailey Pillon

title: Reasonable suspicion, MROs, Employer misuse/abuse, Fourth Amendment (Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Reasonable suspicion, MROs, Employer misuse/abuse, Fourth Amendment (Department of Health and Human Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552. I hereby request the following records:

All records within the jurisdiction of the HHS as it specifically relates to SAMHSA (with which the HHS has oversight) related to, within the time frame of 2017 to 2023, to be the day on which this request is processed:

1. Records/documents that describe and detail the policies and procedures surrounding reasonable suspicion drug testing per federal law (ie, Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988).
 
2. Records/documents that relate to policies/procedures/manuals (such as training manual(s)) for which Medical Review Officers (MROs) are to adhere to per SAMHSA and the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988. To clarify, such records should relate to MROs.

3. Records/documents that relate to employer abuse or misuse of SAMSHA, including but not limited to making false or fictitious statements to SAMSHA, and the consequences of an employer abusing SAMSHA.

4.Records/documents that relate to employer consequences, ramifications, or disciplinary actions when an employer intentionally abusing or defrauding SAMSHA (as an example, by trick or deceit).

5. Records/documents relating to if/when/how the fourth amendment applies as it relates to private employers (ie, nongovernmental employers) subjecting to reasonable suspicion drug testing.

6. Records/documents relating to the precise criteria and definition of reasonable suspicion per the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988.

7. Records/documents relating to if or in what manner an employer’s policies can extend beyond the scope of the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988 and SAMSHA’s guidelines (if such records exist) and/or what must be explicitly or expressly stated in an employer's policies related to a drug-free workplace.

8. Records that detail the sources of how or where to search for Federal Contracts in the amount of $100,000 or more OR Federal Grants when it is known that an employer must comply with SAMSHA and the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988.

9. Records that detail or relate to records an employee may seek and if the HHS or any agency with the HHS has oversight over if it is the case that employee submits to drug testing per the Drug-Free Workplace Place Act of 1988 under mere suspicion (ie, failure of an employer to meet the legal criteria of reasonable suspicion) and if or what manner the fourth amendment may apply to a private employer given the context of SAMHSA forming a direct nexus under the circumstances (if it known or under the jurisdiction of the HHS or SAMHSA).


I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to be processed. Depending of the time frame for the request to be fulfilled and any fees that may be incurred, I may revise the criteria.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

Additionally, I wish to if or in what manner the fourth amendment may apply in the context of a private employer and if such employer is considered a state actor, acting on behalf of the government, or acting under the direction of the government given the direct nexus to the SAMHSA under the circumstances. 

Thank you,

Bailey Pillon

title: Disciplinary Actions, Agency Scope, and Investigative Authority, and more

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Disciplinary Actions, Agency Scope, and Investigative Scope, and more
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records, within the timeframe of 2017 to 2023. to the date on which this request is processed, and with respect to the following criteria and jurisdiction of the EEOC:

1. Records that detail the consequences, ramifications, or disciplinary action of intentionally abusing or misusing the EEOC by a respondent party, including but not limited to making fictitious statements to the EEOC by a respondent party.

2. Records that detail the precise scope and jurisdiction of the EEOC itself.

3. Records, manuals, and/or guidelines that detail how the EEOC handles position statements and rebuttals to position statements.

4. Records that detail the precise scope and investigatory authority or power of an EEOC investigator.

5. Records that detail the extent of what the charging party may request of a respondent as it relates to requests of evidence and how such is handled by the EEOC.

6. Records that detail the precise corrective actions with which the EEOC may impose on the respondent party in the event that the respondent loses, so to speak. To clarify, I request to know such corrective actions in enumeration.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon
